title: MARK21
author: MARK21
content: Quote“After rising significantly in value and popularity, the meme cryptocurrency Dogecoin (DOGE) now finds greater use in illicit activities”The currency is apparently being used by criminals to facilitate vices such as fraud, scams, Ponzi schemes, terrorism, and the sale of millions of dollars worth of child sexual abuse materials, according to research published by Elliptical Connection on June 22.According to research, it is said that:QuoteHigh-profile crimes facilitated by Dogecoin involve scams, fraud, and Ponzi schemes numbering around 50 cases.Some of the notable crimes include the Plus Token Ponzi scheme that resulted in the seizure of over $20 million in DOGE by Chinese authorities and the alleged theft of $119 million in Dogecoin linked to a Turkish Ponzi scheme in 2021.Breakdown of DOGE usage in crime. Source: Elliptic ConnectSource: https://finbold.com/doge-records-increased-utilisation-in-criminal-activities-research-shows/

comments.author: Z-tight
comments.body: Not Doge, but fraudulent humans who commit crimes are increasing in their criminal activities. Criminals can choose to perpetrate their crime with any cryptocurrency, or best of all they use fiat. This is similar to the lie that "bitcoin facilitates crimes and criminal activities".

comments.author: jackg
comments.body: The thread title and topic is a bit laughable... I don't think any traceable crime could really occur when doge was 15 sats .But yes as things increase in popularity and price you can expect criminals to try to monopolise off that as well as people who don't understand why something's gone up not caring about where they put it (if they've not mentally realised the gain in actual numbers or don't need it).

comments.body: Quote from: MARK21 on June 22, 2022, 07:05:29 PMThe currency is apparently being used by criminals to facilitate vices such as fraud, scams, Ponzi schemes, terrorism, and the sale of millions of dollars worth of child sexual abuse materials, according to research published by Elliptical Connection on June 22.According to research, it is said that:QuoteHigh-profile crimes facilitated by Dogecoin involve scams, fraud, and Ponzi schemes numbering around 50 cases.Some of the notable crimes include the Plus Token Ponzi scheme that resulted in the seizure of over $20 million in DOGE by Chinese authorities and the alleged theft of $119 million in Dogecoin linked to a Turkish Ponzi scheme in 2021.There are many things in the world that can be used for the benefit of human beings. Cryptocurrency is one of them. Just think of the little knife we ​​use to do the necessary work every day, on the other hand, many people are harming people or animals with this same thing, so we can not blame the knife.

comments.author: AmoreJaz
comments.body: Quote from: Z-tight on June 22, 2022, 07:18:14 PMNot Doge, but fraudulent humans who commit crimes are increasing in their criminal activities. Criminals can choose to perpetrate their crime with any cryptocurrency, or best of all they use fiat. This is similar to the lie that "bitcoin facilitates crimes and criminal activities".exactly! so doge, bitcoin or any other crypto coins can be subject to this kind of propaganda. but when you compare it with fiat-related fraudulent activities, i believe the crypto numbers is just a small one. fiat is still the leading market to be used in fraudulent or illegal activities. people are just highlighting the use of crypto in criminal activities, and so the negative notion of the public towards crypto, ignoring the fact that fiat is still the major currency used in this kind of illicit activities.

comments.author: coupable
comments.body: I don't think it has a direct relationship to the price of the Dodge coin to be used for illegal activities ; In my opinion, the nature of the currency in itself is what makes it a safe haven for anyone who wants to try something that requires a sufficient amount of anonymity and privacy.Dodge currency is decentralized because there is no central work team working on developing the network. Therefore, it is not possible in any way to freeze balances or addresses, as happens with many other currencies. And it is also difficult to track transfers and addresses on its network, that is, not as happens with Bitcoin, for example, which has many means of tracking transfers on its blockchain network.Elon Musk exploited him in almost the same way, and it is certain that his choice was deliberate and not arbitrary.

comments.author: avikz
comments.body: Quote from: Z-tight on June 22, 2022, 07:18:14 PMNot Doge, but fraudulent humans who commit crimes are increasing in their criminal activities. Criminals can choose to perpetrate their crime with any cryptocurrency, or best of all they use fiat. This is similar to the lie that "bitcoin facilitates crimes and criminal activities".That's true! It's the human who is committing the crimes and using cryptos for their transactions. This is a true statement! However, it is also true that cryptocurrency has given criminals a great way to transfer crime proceedings to another criminal. Cryptos like XMR is a great tool for the money launderers. Not sure why Doge is becoming a favorite among criminals, but XMR leads this segment. Criminals have always wanted to avoid banking channel and cryptocurrency, especially privacy cryptocurrencies have given criminals a great choice for sending or receiving payments.

comments.author: Eridan_world
comments.body: Quote from: avikz on June 23, 2022, 05:33:19 PMQuote from: Z-tight on June 22, 2022, 07:18:14 PMNot Doge, but fraudulent humans who commit crimes are increasing in their criminal activities. Criminals can choose to perpetrate their crime with any cryptocurrency, or best of all they use fiat. This is similar to the lie that "bitcoin facilitates crimes and criminal activities".That's true! It's the human who is committing the crimes and using cryptos for their transactions. This is a true statement! However, it is also true that cryptocurrency has given criminals a great way to transfer crime proceedings to another criminal. Cryptos like XMR is a great tool for the money launderers. Not sure why Doge is becoming a favorite among criminals, but XMR leads this segment. Criminals have always wanted to avoid banking channel and cryptocurrency, especially privacy cryptocurrencies have given criminals a great choice for sending or receiving payments. But at the same time, nothing prevented criminals from doing their business without cryptocurrency. Yes, it may have become more convenient for them, but this is probably the price for the fact that it has also become much more convenient for all law-abiding citizens.

comments.author: Anonylz
comments.body: What is attracting criminals to use dogecoin for their bas activities? Is it because of the very cheap transaction fees, or dogecoin is more private and can not be easily traced by the government?

comments.author: Xal0lex
comments.body: Quote from: MARK21 on June 22, 2022, 07:05:29 PMSome of the notable crimes include the Plus Token Ponzi scheme that resulted in the seizure of over $20 million in DOGE by Chinese authorities and the alleged theft of $119 million in Dogecoin linked to a Turkish Ponzi scheme in 2021.Well, the news background around DOGE keeps getting worse and worse. First accusations of manipulation from Ilon Musk, now the use of the coin in various fraud schemes. In the meantime, the coin keeps falling to the bottom, having already reached 6 cents. I wouldn't be surprised if the price drops below 1 cent soon, because the price of it has been actively pumped up too much lately. If this news about ponzi schemes and other frauds involving DOGE is spreading more widely now, exchanges may start to remove this coin from listing massively, like it happened with Ripple in its time, and then DOGE will start to sink even more massively.

comments.author: jrrsparkles
comments.body: Probably those criminals thought that doge coin will increase a lot in the future so they demanded or used Dogecoin instead of others. How the survey can be real? Not really a fan of Dogecoin or memecoins in general but its just seems like a make-up story to defame the value for short time so the big whales can buy it for cheaper.

comments.author: so98nn
comments.body: Nothing much different than what happens with bitcoin or fiat. They are also being used to do criminal activities since many years now. I’m wondering why is it any different when it comes to DOGE. These are just numbers by the way. I believe if they really want to go for the Ponzi schemes and stuff then they might use new coins, even create new coins so that they will get less attention while transferring those funds. Doge is too popular whether in funny way or normal use case.

comments.author: blue_hurricanger
comments.body: I think Doge got a lot of normal people who use and hold it, this makes it look easy to be diluted in case of criminal activities want to remove its track. So can't really blame Doge for that.

comments.author: hyudien
comments.body: Doge and similar altcoins are just tools, and tools depend on how they are used. Like a double edged knife, you can use it to hurt other people or you can use it to slice onions. There is no denying that the fact is not always that crypto is a hotbed of fraudsters, but rather fraudsters who try to evade identification to eliminate evidence.

comments.author: Morningstarr
comments.body: According to the investigation, about two trillion US dollars are used every year in various crimes. Should we ban the dollar or has the US government ever taken any drastic measures to stop it? All their emphasis is on propaganda against the corrupt currency. Everything can be used in both good and bad ways.
